Description:
1960's Architecture in McIvor Hill Precinct on (approx) 3000m2 of land
In a setting that has you established on a hobby-lifestyle property, minutes to Bendigo Central, is this glorious and original example of 1960's architecture. Sited on just under 3000m2 of land in a prominent and envious location, this 4 bedroom solid brick home will have you planning its next phase of eternity.
You step back in time, once you enter the parquetry floored foyer room entrance with fixtures, fittings and design of what was very evident of this popular era.
In all its glory this home offers sizeable bedrooms with the main having an ensuite and storage, and all other bedrooms with huge built-in robes. Glass windows are an extension of allowing natural light throughout the two living areas.
There is also a huge open home office/study.
The charismatic design throughout will have you boasting to everyone you know.
Kitchen with ample cupboards, benches and electrical appliances including dishwasher.
Fully tiled original bathroom with separate toilet and laundry.
Various heating and cooling options throughout include a welcoming wood heater and refrigerated reverse-cycle heating and cooling system.
Outside is where your parkland surrounds have established gums, massive back yard that overlooks the welcoming back veranda and remote gable Spanline paved area.
A separate pool house has cathedral ceilings with full bathroom facilities and storage room. The in-ground, gas heated pool is used all year round.
Double carport meets up with the welcoming asphalt drive, plus separate third vehicle accommodation for a boat, caravan or camper.
The potential to subdivide (STCA) if that's what you are looking for either in the short or long term, will have you benefiting to create extra assets, within the asset of the property.
Homes like this seldom become available to purchase.
40 years ownership with our current vendors and built by a prominent Bendigo family in 1965, become the third owner of this iconic property and be a part of its history.
Top shelf positioning just off Mill Street, McIvor Road, minutes to CBD, train station, schools, university and excellent recreational amenities.
This property is a one-off in today's market.

Description:
PERFECT FAMILY HOME OR QUALITY INVESTMENT IN OUTSTANDING LOCATION
Located in a peaceful avenue in a prime pocket of Kennington, an immaculate, yet easy to maintain garden including a gorgeous paved pathway and stone retaining walls make a wonderful first impression.
Stepping up onto the landing and through the front door you are greeted with an entryway of stunning polished hardwood floors and onto a bedroom, complete with built in robe. The master bedroom then follows with a built in dressing table and mirror, walk-in-robe and access trough to a cleverly designed semi-ensuite with shower. This flows onto a separate toilet and bathroom with a shower over bath and vanity which can also be accessed from the main hallway.
A study which could be utilised as a formal lounge, or kids activity room adds another layer of versatility to the home, as well as another two spacious bedrooms which both include built-in-robes and are all accessible just off the main hallway.
The kitchen, dining and living area is filled with natural light and views over the tranquil back garden. The kitchen has everything a cook could desire with ample bench and cupboard space and a sizeable pantry. The dining area offers plenty of room for a large family table and leads onto a generously sized, carpeted lounge room that showcases exposed ceiling trusses and can be closed off from the kitchen and dining area with timber bi-fold doors. Timber skirting boards and window architraves as well as stained glass room dividers add plenty of character and charm to the home.
Stairs from the kitchen lead down to a large and welcoming back yard that includes an established vegetable garden, fruit trees and chook pen allowing you to produce your own food, as well as a timber rotunda complete with a wood fired pizza oven – perfect for entertaining guests. A gate also provides direct access to a children’s playground where you can literally sit in the back yard while watching the kids enjoy themselves. Under the home is a large laundry with handy access to the washing line as well as a powered workshop area and plenty of storage space.
Additional features include:
Ducted heating and split system cooling
Electric stove-top and oven, dishwasher
Venetian blinds and curtains throughout
Freshly painted and new carpet throughout
Plenty of storage and cupboard space
Large water tank
From a family looking for a quality home in a perfect location, to an intelligent investor – with direct access to a playground, walking distance to La Trobe University and close to everything that Kennington and Strathdale has to offer, this home is the complete package.

Description:
Contemporary design, tranquil surrounds and a premium location!
Nestled into its tranquil surrounds, this striking custom built home has been cleverly designed to respond to the topography of its gentle sloping site at the end of a quiet court. Sheltered by quality built homes on the high side of the Reservoir; this blue chip property is perfectly positioned in walking distance to open parkland, Kennington Reservoir’s bushland reserves and only a short drive from Bendigo’s thriving arts and café culture.
The unique contemporary design features a series of gracefully curved rooflines and multi-level internal and external spaces that combine to create a home that is both sculptural and highly functional. The highly considered floorplan divides the split level property into a series of raised pavilions linked by internal glass bridges and raised timber decks resulting in beautifully finished spaces flooded with natural light.
High end design features are referenced throughout the clean lines of the home including honey coloured hard wood timber flooring, square set (no cornice) finishes, marble-look Tuscan ceramic tiling, sleek black window frames and external iron balustrades, distinctive floor to ceiling corner windows, internal smoked glass balustrading, soaring 3.6 metre and 2.7 metre high ceilings and custom built shelving and cabinetry - resulting in a minimalist contemporary Danish design aesthetic.
A formal entrance with raised landing overlooks the first of the three pavilions; each with a separate living zone, bedroom accommodation, bathroom facilities and internal sliders to connect or close off each space as needed. Located on the highest point of the block at street level; the first pavilion houses the formal living and luxurious master suite complete with hidden walk through robe, TV point and elegant dual access ensuite with vanity, frameless shower screen, toilet and heated towel rail.
The central pavilion comprises an enormous open plan kitchen-dining-living room, study or fourth bedroom with built in shelving and robes, guest powder room and family laundry. The chef designed G shaped kitchen features a dramatic black glass splashback, iridescent stone benchtops, double sink and stainless steel appliances including a new dishwasher and 900mm cooker with 6 burner gas cooktop and electric oven. The custom built kitchen includes elegant backlit glass display cabinets, cleverly hidden appliance storage and a large walk in pantry with floor to ceiling shelving and provision for a refrigerator.
The lower pavilion houses a large family games room, two double bedrooms with built in robes and family bathroom with bath, vanity, shower and separate powder room. The series of raised external desks include a combination of sophisticated open and covered outdoor entertaining spaces that can be accessed through glass sliders on all three levels. These capitalise on the parkland and water views that make this location so highly sought after.
Further features include:
- Hydronic heating & split system heating & cooling in all three pavilions
- Ceiling fans indoors and outdoors
- Double garage with auto door plus additional workshop or storage capacity
- Secure internal access from garage to formal entrance hall
- New 8 panel 1.5 KW solar system
- Side gate side access to fully secure rear yard
- Colourbond fencing with rear gate access to sporting fields & reservoir
- Sleek external blinds for additional internal temperature control
- Additional under-house general and rainwater storage
- Meticulously maintained and fully landscaped surrounds featuring mop tops, hedging, drought tolerant plantings and dripper system
Only minutes from schools and local shops and cafes including the new Kennington Village and Edwards Providore; this is a unique, stylish and versatile home built without compromise.

You've been waiting for this! Something very different and energy efficient, with a blend of modern building materials, recycled timbers and bricks, plus a list of features that will blow your mind. A lot of love & hard work has gone into the transformation of this home, with the home being extended, refurbished and extensively renovated in recent years. The location is fantastic with the choice of two primary schools within walking distance, secondary school, Latrobe Uni, supermarkets, sporting facilities and Kennington Reservoir all nearby and the CBD of Bendigo a mere 5 minutes away.
The master suite features his & hers walk through robe, updated ensuite with an oversized shower, luxurious freestanding bath, vanity & toilet. There are three more bedrooms and a study on this level, two have built in robes and share the second bathroom which has also been lavishly updated with twin vanity basins, oversized shower, linen storage & separate toilet. The spacious open plan kitchen/dining/living zone with soaring ceilings, tonnes of natural light and beautiful timber floors, features an updated kitchen with loads of bench space, pot drawers, 900mm Smeg electric oven and cooktop, dishwasher walk in pantry and an island bench with breakfast bar and pendant lighting. The meals area that lies adjacent, easily caters for a dining table, whilst the living area is a great place to relax with the family. The dining space opens out to the first of three alfresco areas, a great place to relax and watch the world go by. The second alfresco area is accessed through double doors from the light filled sitting area, with lovely old red brick paving & lush lawn area, perfect for entertaining your family and friends around the firepit or your morning coffee. Moving upstairs via the staircase made from Tasmanian Oak, you find a massive area that has several uses such as bedrooms, second lounge, teenagers retreat or accommodation for guests. There is also a huge amount of natural light & storage upstairs. Other internal features are quality fixtures & fittings, laundry with good storage, reclaimed timber feature walls, gas infra-red heating & three split systems.
For the car accommodation there is a single carport off Marshall Avenue plus another carport off Lowndes Street. There is the bonus of heaps of under house storage. One area that measures approximately 10m x 8m, great for a mancave, workshop, storing the garden tools, plus another area that has a wine cellar and room for further storage.
Some of the many energy saving features are a 1.5Kw solar panel system, double glazed windows, large windows for natural light, passive air conditioning using cross air flow through louvre windows & French doors, heat transfer system & water tanks to irrigate the gardens.
A very unique home in an excellent location with all the amenities you could need nearby. Homes like this are rare, so don't delay and make an appointment today to inspect your new home.
